page.title: 18A Jersey Farm
page.content: I live on a farm in St. Lawrence, Jersey. My dad grows crops, potatoes to export to England, mangolds and kale for cattle feed in the winter. We have nine fields and they were all recorded in the 1985 Domesday survey. We have sixteen cows, two bulls, six heifers, five cats and one dog. We have a big farmhouse with an old arch, all made of granite. All the water we use comes from a well. We used to have pigs, chickens and rabbits. There was a big garden where the new shed is now and apple trees grew all around our house. Probably the apples were used to make cider. My dad has lived at our farm all his life. My grandfather lived there too. I think my great grandfather built the farm.
